seniority_level.evidence: Title explicitly states 'Senior Data Engineer' and requires 5+ years of professional experience in data engineering or related roles.

job_family.evidence: Title is 'Sr Data Engineer' and core responsibilities focus on data pipelines, ETL, and cloud data platforms.

sub_specialty.evidence: Focus on data warehousing (AWS Redshift, Azure Synapse, GCP BigQuery) and data modeling, with no clear emphasis on streaming or lakehouse.

leadership_expectation.evidence: Role mentions mentoring junior engineers, providing technical leadership, and collaborating with stakeholders, but does not mention direct reports or people management.

primary_cloud.evidence: Multiple cloud platforms (AWS Redshift, Azure Synapse, GCP BigQuery) are mentioned with no clear primary focus.

secondary_clouds.evidence: AWS, Azure, and GCP are all listed as must-have skills for cloud data platforms.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Apache Spark (often used for batch) and Airflow (used for orchestration of both batch and streaming) are mentioned, but no explicit streaming tools or paradigms are stated.

orchestrator_category.evidence: Apache Airflow is explicitly mentioned as a must-have skill.

storage_layer.evidence: AWS Redshift, Azure Synapse, and GCP BigQuery (warehouse) are mentioned alongside general cloud-based data architectures, suggesting a mix of storage patterns.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location is specified as 'Denver, CO' with an onsite work model and no remote work allowed.

timezone_focus.evidence: No timezone requirements or team distribution details are mentioned.

relocation_required.evidence: Onsite role in Denver, CO, with no mention of remote work, suggests relocation may be required for non-residents.

h1b_friendly.evidence: No visa sponsorship is mentioned in the job posting.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No explicit mention of OPT/CPT or student visa support, and the role requires work authorization.

citizenship_required.evidence: Job posting states 'authorized to work' without specifying citizenship or green card requirements.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Position is full-time and permanent with comprehensive benefits, indicating W2 employment.

benefits_level.evidence: Multiple premium benefits mentioned, including medical, dental, vision, life, disability insurances, 401k, ESPP, HSA, FSA, paid parental leave, and tuition reimbursement.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'promotional opportunities', 'training and development', and 'career development support' without explicit career tracks.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Explicitly states mentoring junior data engineers and mentions 'mentorship' in the career development section.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal mobility, lateral moves, or team changes in the job posting.

career_tracks_available.evidence: Mentions 'promotional opportunities' and 'career development support', which can imply both IC and management tracks, but no explicit mention of tracks.

requirement_strictness.evidence: Job posting has a clear distinction with many 'required' skills and few 'nice to have' skills.

scope_definition.evidence: Job description is focused on a single role with well-defined responsibilities in data engineering.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Requirements align well with the senior level (5+ years, senior title, and reasonable must-have skills).
